Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Elfenwunder (Issue 2 - Jan 1989)
boardgame.description: 36 pages (plus inserts) with content primarily for DSA, con reports etc.

boardgame.name: Sinosphere: Global Conflict
boardgame.description:
Sinosphere: Global Conflict is a d100 retro-style mass combat wargame based on the modern and near future (2020 - 2034) predicted war in the First Island Chain and South China Sea.
You will play as a number of global and regional superpowers, as they battle for their own set of ideals and alliances.

This game allows the players to visualise the incoming conflict.
China has already told the world it wants to take Taiwan by any means and eyes longingly other islands in the first island chain.
America has not confirmed its defence of the island.

However, Japan has, with its own islands at risk from the waking dragon.

The game is intended for 28-32mm minis

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Poison for Beginners
boardgame.description:
Want a way to hurt people with plants that isn’t whacking someone with an oaken quarterstaff? Want a subtle and engaging playstyle that rewards research and effort?

Poison for Beginners is the book for you—with 26 pages containing 20 truly unique and odd poisons, system agnostic rules for foraging, refining, and purchasing poison (along with a couple Powered by the Apocalypse moves), and lovely black and white illustrations, it's a must-read for anyone that's interested in plants that can defend themselves. It also includes examples of play for ease of use, and suggestions for use in a D20 system, such as D&D 5E.

boardgame.name: Les chiffres croisés
boardgame.description:
The principle of the game is quite simple: each player must perform the numbers indicated on cards drawn at random at the start of the game. For that he places numbered pawns on the board he is going to add. The combinations can be crossed on the board, each result being obtained horizontally or vertically.
Players score points for each combination by adding the number of tokens used to the value of the combination made. Whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Ordeal Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A promo-expansion included in LMS' Ashes Magazine (Essen Special 3), consisting of 12 cards providing potential bonuses in end-game scoring if conditions are met.

In game setup, each mage will get 2 Ordeal Cards of which 1 must be kept. The Ordeal Card will show 2 objectives that can each provide additional points for the mage in end-game scoring when met. However, if none of the objectives are met then the Black Rose will receive a significant amount of points.

boardgame.name: Das Grosse Spiel
boardgame.description:
The game is played on the large playing area with 56 picture panels, which are covered by as many stones. Each player lifts two game pieces and shows the pictures underneath. If the pictures match, the player has already won two stones.

He can also put these stones "at risk". The dice then decides how far the risk disc is turned and this shows whether the stones keep their simple value, are lost or are worth twice as much as before. Lost stones remain on the risk disc and wait for the luckier player.

The player who owns the biggest number of stones at the end of the game win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Doctor Who
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Based on the well known British TV show.

You play as Doctor Who armed with his Sonic Screwdriver trying to find the Key of Time, which you need to collect the six pieces from, which will drop each level's adversaries.

If you die in one of the seven lives you have you, you will regenerate into a different incarnation.

The Doctor also have companions, which can be computer controlled or controlled by Player 2.

boardgame.name: Dozer
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Kind of like Lemmings: You control a small bulldozer which you need to help a red dinosaur walking, in circles, to get back into it's cage.

Shareware with 10 levels, with a full version available for purchase.

boardgame.name: Vindsjäl
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book (in Swedish):

Upplev bravader och strapatser tillsammans med dina kamrater. Utforska mystiska djungelruiner. Avgör konflikter mellan hövdingar. Bekämpa Sorgens intrång. Bli en hjälte för de ofta bortglömda vanliga människorna.

Vindsjäl är ett äventyrsrollspel med fokus på frihet, upptäckarglädje och kamratskap – för dig som vill utforska en färgstark och främmande värld. Boken innehåller:


Ett regelsystem utvecklat för att främja spelflyt, frihet och kreativitet.
Vägledning för att skapa livfulla rollpersoner och ett dynamiskt band av äventyrare.
Introduktion till spelvärlden Agweon – kulturer, platser, grupperingar och varelser, med mera.
Tips och verktyg för att leda spelet.


Ett förberett introduktionsäventyr.

User translation:

Experience great deeds and hardship together with your companions. Explore mysterious jungle ruins. Settle disputes between chieftains. Fight against the incursion of the Sorrow. Become a hero of the often forgotten ordinary people.

Vindsjäl (direct translation Windsoul) is an adventerous roleplaying game focusing on freedom, joy of discovery and camaraderie–for those who want to explore a colourful and strange world. This book contains:


A ruleset developed to encourage game flow, freedom and creativity.
Guidance for creating vibrant player characters and a dynamic band of adventurers.
Introduction to the world of Agweon–cultures, places, groups and creatures, and more.
Advice and tools for leading the game.
A prepared introduction adventure.

boardgame.name: Oath of the Good Traitor
boardgame.description:
Tired of paladin oaths that seem to constantly shoehorn yourself into some sort of lawful, do-gooder path? Want a paladin oath with some grit to it without being an evildoer? Look no further—the Oath of the Good Traitor is part inquisitor, part whistleblower, and all fierce commitment to justice.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Christmas Time - The Festive Season
X-Mas Time
X-Mas Time - The Festive Season
boardgame.description:
From ingame introduction

It is the 24th of December, and as Santa Claus you are about to head out to spread joy and happiness in the small families around the world (the families who have got a chimney that is). But...

Game released at:
The Party 3 in Herning, 1993.

boardgame.name: Mage Noir: The Lone Mage
boardgame.description:
Mage Noir - The Lone Mage is the Solo & Co-op expansion for Mage Noir.

From 1 to 4 players
40 special new cards exclusive to the solo/co-op mode!
Specific Solo/Co-op mode rulebook included
At least 3 scenarios with 2 difficulty levels
A good replayability
Simple rules that are close to the base game’s rules.
A deeper dive in the Mage Noir Universe.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sword of Honour
boardgame.description:
From in-game description

"Sword of Honour" - The story:
Shogun Yuichiro's family sword (the Sword of Honour) has been stolen by the power-hungry Damion Toranaga. This means disaster for Yuichiro as his honour is violated. The shogun risk loosing his face in the front of the whole country. Facing the act of seppuku (harikiri) if the honour of his dynasty is not restored, the shogun calls for his most dangerous ninja, warrior, you, to find the damion's secret castle and return the sword where it belongs!

The future lies in your hands...


Sword of Honour is an action-adventure video game developed by Dynafield Systems in 1992 for Amiga, Commodore 64 and PC DOS systems. The game took almost three years to finish.

Gameplay
Sword of Honour combines the action-adventure oriented gameplay of the 1987 game The Last Ninja with the side-scrolling perspective of the 1986 games Ninja (aka Ninja Mission) and Fist II: The Legend Continues, and the icon-based controls of the 1987 game Barbarian. The player fights enemies (either in unarmed combat or with the aid of ninjatō, kusarigama, tekagi-shuko, shuriken and kunai), avoids traps, collects and uses items, and interacts with characters.

Plot
The player takes a role of an elite ninja sent for a mission to recover the stolen family sword of the fictional Shogun Yuichiro from a castle of his enemy, the evil Lord Toranaga. The ninja must retrieve the sword and punish Toranaga before Yuichiro will be forced to commit seppuku.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sword of Honour (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Mini Express: US & Europe Playmats
boardgame.description: Set of 2 playmats representing maps for Europe and US.

boardgame.name: Command Adventure Starship
Command Adventures: Starship
Starship
boardgame.description:
From back of box (Canadian)

In a galaxy under siege....
It's the year 2127, Galactic standard time, the closing of the great war is upon us. The galactic conflict has cost the space faring nations far too much and has left devastation and shattered worlds in its wake. Mankind along with the warring alien factions are looking forward to a time of peace. With the war behind you, you purchase a sleek starship to explore regions unlnown and extract untold riches from distant galaxies.
BEWARE !! Pirated and bloodthirsty alien beings wander the universe, attacking anything and everythin within their laser sights, planets are being ransacked and destroyed, old enemies plot revenge. The aftermath of the war has left the universe a virtual haven for scavangers and galactic rifraff; it seems as though you won't be getting as much peace as you thought !!

A spectacular sound and graphic adventure

boardgame.name: Character Critters
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time there was an enchanted forest in a magical land where a playful lioness cub happened upon a storybook with the most wonderful tales. Little lioness imagined herself as the main character with a flowing cape and super strength. She showed the book to all her creature friends, who also dreamed of what it would be like to be one of these fabled names. What if all critters could become their favorite characters? With Character Critters game, you can help them reach this dream!

Character Critters is an imaginative drawing game for the whole family. Every round, each player receives a random Character Card and Critter Card and draws the Critter in the style of the Character. What would a horse look like as Rapunzel? How about a kangaroo Santa Claus? Players draw their Character Critters simultaneously and earn points by guessing drawings correctly and having their drawings correctly guessed. There are also Jr. Character cards included for younger players so they can conjure up a scientist penguin or a frog who’s a clown. With over 4,000 possible card combinations, you’ll flex your creativity and make some delightfully unique art each time you play!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heroes and Divided Lands (fan expansion for Kingdomino and Queendomino)
boardgame.description:
This is an unofficial expansion for the Kingdomino and Queendomino games. Produced with the permission of Blue Orange, for non-commercial use only. To play it, you need to own either of these games. For your games, you can also add the "Age of Giants" expansion and even print the PnP expansion "The Court".

The objective of the game remains the same, to build a kingdom that allows you to score the maximum points! "Heroes and Divided Lands" allows you to add a player, to connect separate domains but most of all to earn points at the end of the game! Adding a player means adding new dominoes. On these dominoes, a square is split into two separate lands. Can you take advantage of these tiles to score more points? Heroes increase the value of your domains.

As this expansion does not officially exist, you will have to make it from the files in order to print all the necessary elements. If you've played Kingdomino or Queendomino before, then you'll love this expansion!


Il s'agit d'une extension non-officielle pour les jeux Kingdomino et Queendomino. Produite avec la permission de Blue Orange, pour un usage non commercial uniquement. Pour être jouée, elle nécessite que vous possédiez l'un ou l'autre de ces jeux. Pour vos parties, vous pouvez également ajouter l'extension "Age of Giants" et même imprimer l'extension PnP "La cour".

L'objectif du jeu reste le même, bâtir un royaume qui vous permette de marquer un maximum de points ! "Heroes and Divided Lands" vous permet d'ajouter un joueur, de réunir des domaines séparés mais surtout de gagner des points en fin de partie ! Ajouter un joueur implique l'ajout de nouveaux dominos. Ceux-ci font apparaître une case séparée en deux domaines distincts. Saurez-vous tirer avantage de ces tuiles pour marquer davantage de point ? Les Héros, quant à eux, augmentent la valeur de vos domaines.

Comme cette extension n'existe pas officiellement, il vous faudra la fabriquer à partir des fichiers joints afin d'imprimer l'ensemble des éléments nécessaires. Si vous avez déjà joué à Kingdomino ou Queendomino, alors vous allez aimer cette extension !

boardgame.name: The Farm
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An adventure for Mörk Borg.

Some of the vendors in Galgenbeck are getting antsy; their profits have dipped because the farmers that usually provide their food stocks haven't been seen in weeks. The PCs are hired to investigate what's happening at the farm. Since it's Mörk Borg, you've probably already guessed that everything is just fine, and the livestock aren't slaughtering people or anything like that.

boardgame.name: With These Phantom Hands
boardgame.description:
A One-Player Tabletop RPG for the #YourMoveJam

You are a ghost, and you can’t even remember how you died. There are three living people who you know to be important to you in some way, but you don’t know why. More important than anything, you have a message you must convey to one of them, but you don’t know what it is.

You are unstuck in time, unsure of who you are, and unable to rest until you’ve figured out what your message is and delivered it.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Folklore Hunter
boardgame.description: You are a hunter world reknowned for slaying supernatural beasts. Your next contract is to hunt down a wendigo plaguing a section of woods in north america. Gather resources, set traps, prepare your equipment, use your hunters instincts and take down the beast, before it hunts you.

boardgame.name: Wild Speed: Space Family
boardgame.description:
" Alright listen up, there's a state of the art A.I. known as Solaris. They plan to develop a new super narcotic so they can take over the White House. We'd stop them ourselves but there's one problem.
They're in space."


Wild Speed: Space Family is a game about an extraordinarily over the top action film. Players play characters in the tenth iteration of a popular action film franchise where ridiculous stunts, inexplicable science, and seemingly magical technology are common elements of the plot. Feel free to base your game off of an existing action film franchise or make up your own.

The characters are part of a crew of thieves, street-racers, and hackers. You’re not just friends, you’re the Family. You’ve done more death-defying heists and impossible missions than you can count. You’ve saved the world at least twice already, and you’ve been approached to do one last job.

And this one is in space.

Players: 2-4
Playtime: 1 hour
Requires: Pencils and erasers, at least 4 six-sided dice, index cards.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Buds and Blooms
boardgame.description:
Rival gardeners compete to see who can grow the best flowers for the annual flower show.
Will your sunflowers be spectacular or simply second-rate?
Will your marigolds be magnificent or merely mediocre?
Whoever grows the tallest and most attractive flowers will be awarded Best in Show!

Players play cards to their flower beds to increase the height of their flowers and attract bees and butterflies. The taller the flower, and the more attractive it is to insects, the more points it will be awarded. The gardener whose flowers score the highest at the end of the game wins.

An entry in the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: What's a Vaporwave
boardgame.description:
A two-player, 200 word RPG about explaining vaporwave to your grandpa. Based on a true story.

One player is Casey, who kinda knows what vaporwave is. Another is Grandpa, who loves Casey and wants to understand their life. Played via text message.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: VETTVANGUR
boardgame.description:
Beacon,
Wielder o' Light.
Step forth,
Hear mine plight.
Enter VETTVANGUR,
To show your might.
Shine your light,
On the agents of Night.


VETTVANGUR, a replayable LIGHT RPG Strike. A strange arena with a stranger inhabitant. Wield the power of Darkness with new weapon tags!

Also includes LIGHT Theme for GMBinder. Simply copy the text from the .txt file and paste it into the GMBinder editor. Read the demo document to see how it works!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: BreakFast & Furious
boardgame.description:
The Hungry Trucker Cafe is under new management and you’ve being hired as its chef. The new menu features all the greasy spoon favourites, as well as a few healthier dishes in an attempt to attract the more discerning clientele.

You'll need to make regular visits to the local market to ensure that your fridge is well stocked with the best ingredients. And Get all the food orders out on time, otherwise you’ll be faced with very hungry, even furious, customers!

The game uses different coloured dice to represent different ingredients. The value of a die will indicate how fresh the ingredient is and this reduces each turn.

Choose ingredients from a pool of dice (the market) to add to your fridge (a bag). Randomly draw ingredients and place them onto the cards to complete orders, avoid penalties and gain rewards. A completed order also gives you a single use special action.

Can you complete enough orders to be awarded "Employee of the Month?".

An entry in the 2021 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: MAG/US and Companion 0
boardgame.description:
The Micro Agnostic Gaming/Universal Storytelling engine is a barebones, single page game. This game is an active experiment of a bare essential tool kit to play any kind of TTRPG you wish, whether as starfaring psionic mercenaries, or the classic medieval fantasy of elves and dwarves.

The game is simple to play but open ended enough to be customized to your liking. In fact, it's so open ended it's released under CC BY 4.0 with minimal restrictions (more information in the document). Not only can you hack this easily into the game you want, but you can polish your hack up and sell it completely royalty free. Big thing is credit where it's due and not to use MAG/US in the title of your products.

Included with this document is the first companion book. It is also free because, while it's not exactly essential to have it to play, it does clear up the vagueness and word choice of the single page rules, as well as gives advice on running a game. This section is not released under creative commons, but you may freely adapt the advice in your own words.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: True Believer
boardgame.description:
You are a soldier — a True Believer — caught in a millennia-long endless war of attrition, far from the warmth of your Birth-Star. None of you know the Enemy, though they are shaped like you, and some of your comrades claim they hear them speak in tongues not unlike yours through the trench walls, late at night...

True Believer is a roleplaying game for any number of players (including solo) about empathy, connection, and loss. You play as a soldier caught in a ceaseless war perpetrated by religious fanatics against an enemy you know nothing about. Through their abandoned trenches, their charred wargear, and their desperate charges, we learn who they are and how we are not so different. Through our own desperate acts, we learn what — who — we are forced to give up to dance to the lies of our masters.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Tricksters
boardgame.description:
Become a trickster charged with protecting a small village. Teach the villagers lessons and chase after your worldly desires. Then see what sordid tales these mortals tell of your bizarre interventions.


“Lord, what fools these mortals be!”

- Puck, A Midsummer Night's Dream





Tricksters is a tabletop roleplaying game for 2-5 players. One player will take on the role of the Facilitator (GM), the other players will embody unique tricksters charged with protecting a village.

The Village is created collaboratively by answering questions, leaving the look and feel of the game setting up to the group. The tricksters are comprised of their True Form, Human Form, Tricks and Desires all of which are up to the players. There are no lists to chose from or powers to pick.

The game mechanics are simple focusing on the two most important things for a trickster, Teaching a Lesson and Fulfilling a Desire. When you need to make a roll you build a pool of six-sided dice based on if you have help, you're using a trick or are trying to resist a desire.

In the end you'll come up with the moral or expression the villagers use to remember this little fable you've told.

Tricksters was created for the #folklorejam

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Tiny God: A Tiny Game of Two-Minute Mindfulness
boardgame.description:
You are bonded to a tiny god who follows you everywhere and is very interested in what you have to say. Your tiny god has a lot of questions--how will you answer them?

Tiny God is a very small LARP for one player. It is barely a game and has almost no rules, and fits on the size of a business card. Tiny God is about talking through your thoughts with a companion who is always interested in you, even if they don't always understand.

Your Tiny God intends to help you slow down when you need a moment. It is a small opportunity to work through your thoughts while envisioning the potential for beauty in space. This is a short game meant to be played throughout the day or whenever you need it.

This nanogame was initially designed as a folding business card but is now available digitally. It includes:


a print-and-play version designed to fold and fit in your wallet/pocket.
One vertically scrolling digital image.
One horizontally scrolling digital image.


Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.rpg: Tiny God: A Tiny Game of Two-Minute Mindfulness

boardgame.name: This Is My Final Recording
boardgame.description:
You are part of the Mount Qaf Exploitation Project. Months ago, your corporate backers discovered something marvelous. Something miraculous. A method to tunnel into another realm, into the legendary Mount Qaf, the barrier between the worlds of man and djinn. An opportunity to connect with another species! To leapfrog our understanding of metaphysics! History! Ourselves! A thing with unlimited potential to advance the human condition!

Naturally, you started doing horribly unethical science experiments and bickering over funding. This will probably kill you, and it’ll probably suck, but that isn’t important.

What is important is this: When they pick over the ruins of this horrorshow, you will have named the creatures gnawing at your bones.

This Is My Final Recording is a rules-light game that aims to create the apocalyptic logs so common in video games and found footage media. You play the employees of the Mount Qaf Exploitation Project as your capitalistic over-reach results in terrible and unknown creatures that try to murder you. It is designed to be easily playable through the restrictions of social distancing guidelines, with letters, emails, and text communications all valid modes of play.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: They Won't Go When I Go
boardgame.description:
They Won’t Go When I Go is a GM-less TTRPG of ritual remembrance, funerals and grave visits for two or more players.

In it, we tell the story of a group of people and their yearly visits to a deceased friend, the Ghost. Every year, they return to perform the traditional grave rites left for them. Every year, something changes.

While playing, we will take on the roles of these Visitors. Over the course of the game, we discover their relationships with the Ghost, confront problems, make decisions and reveal stories. Each one of us will have a unique story to narrate and uncover.

Gather together, visit the deceased, piece together what you can, and complete the rites.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.rpg: They Won't Go When I Go

boardgame.description:
The Soviet Union lasted 74 years.

In the mid-1980s, a board game was created in one of Moscow intelligentsia circles, the participants of which found themselves in the center of the events of Soviet history, which was not yet over. Only the board was left of the game. Thirty years later, we found it in the International Memorial Museum.

The game was recreated, made more dynamic and modern. 74 models the stories of several families in the 20th century. The heroes of the game get married and fall into insanity, get an education and meet celebrities, sit in gulag camps and try to survive the war.

148 historical events presented in the game paint a comprehensive picture of Soviet life and tell about culture and science, wars and economic breakthroughs, political terror and international relations. Each event has a different effect on the characters, depending on their class (worker, peasant, "former", security officer, military, specialist, enemy of the people and informal) and how their personal life develop.
When moving along the board, player pick a card for their character personal life and another for the USSR.

The game ends when one of the players gets to 1991, the end of the Soviet Union.

The winner is the one who scored the most points by participating in various historical events, as well as the achievements of the Soviet country, in which his/her characters participated.

– mostly translated from the publisher

boardgame.name: Supernova
boardgame.description:
Command an elite group of death-defying spaceships desperately harvesting energy from a dying star before it explodes in this game of orbital mechanics. Utilizing a unique spiral gameboard inspired by the ancient Egyptian game of Mehen (previously reconstructed and released by the same game designer, Zach Horton), Supernova requires you to make tough choices, as all of your ships must share the same energy allotment, and it is never enough to power them all at once.  The more you power, the fewer Boost Points each one receives, restricting its maneuverability.  This is a high-stakes tradeoff, as the star's gravity pulls all of your ships ever closer. You'll need to boost your orbits to keep from burning up.

Ships move in a counterclockwise spiral toward the star at the center, while the star releases energy bursts (cubes) that travel clockwise toward the edges of the board.  The core of the game lies in the interactions between the energy cubes and ships as they collide.  Different types of cubes behave differently, but all are dangerous and all are valuable if you can capture them.  Clear and yellow cubes can be stored and used as energy to perform special actions, while yellow and red cubes count as victory points at the end of the game.  These energy cubes serve as your primary obstacles, primary goal, in-game currency, and victory points.

Players take turns deciding how many ships to power and then moving each one according to both gravity and Boost Points.  Ships can form special formations to help protect them, block your opponents, and collect energy cubes.  After players have taken their turns, each round ends with a "star action" that moves the cubes on the board and releases new ones.  The sequence of star actions is determined by randomly drawing cards when you set up the game.  Thus every game is completely different.  Players can only see the star cards for the current and next rounds, and therefore have limited information about future conditions.  Despite this element of long-term uncertainty, however, there is no other luck in the game.  Players have complete control over the outcomes of their actions.

Supernova is relatively easy to play, but exceptionally difficult to master, as it asks you to think in spiral rather than linear geometry.  The game's mechanics offer many possible ways to achieve your goals, but far more options become available when you begin to work with rather than against the spiral: sometimes the most efficient path from A to B is the long way around...

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
This is a brandnew, sealed copy. Latest edition. Fresh from Kickstarter. USA shipping please ask for a quote to your zip. Can combine shipping for multiple games.
3 lbs 13x10x4 inch

boardgame.name: A Thief in the White
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Something is causing a businessman in Easthaven to have the worst luck imaginable, and he thinks it’s a ghost. As adventurers, you’re well equipped to handle just that sort of thing and go to help this poor man. As usual for when things get weird in Icewind Dale, there’s much more to the story than a simple “haunting,” and you find yourselves helping an invisible town called Sunlit solve the bad luck mystery. A 4-hour Dungeons and Dragons Plague of Ancients adventure, meant for players level 1-4.

This is the first version. With further testing / community advice, the PDF will be updated to Revision 2 on 5/7/2021.

Seed: I’d Like to Make a Return, Please

Warning: These adventures use the seeds as a base and then wildly diverge.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Dug Too Deep?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You found what was causing the bad luck in Easthaven and realized it went much farther than that one part of Ten Towns. With the luck-depriving object in tow, you aim to return it to its rightful owners: a kobold tribe that runs a gem mine near Termalaine. When the people you mean to give it to show up, they are acting strange, confused, and hostile. You are now tasked with figuring out what has happened to the kobold tribe. A 4-hour Dungeons and Dragons Plague of Ancients adventure, meant for players level 1-4.

This is the first version. With further testing / community advice, the PDF will be updated to Revision 2 on 5/7/2021.

Seed: In Too Deep

Warning: These adventures use the seeds as a base and then wildly diverge.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: A Solstice Tradition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Talk of a snipe, a legendary creature with magical feathers, comes to Lonelywood. It seems like nothing more than an interesting rumor, but it gives the people of Sunlit a great idea: a race to “hunt down” a snipe across the Lonelywood Forest. The game is on, all of Sunlit is excited, and you’re in on the fun. Let’s see what contests and circus acts pop up in this new solstice tradition. A 4-hour Dungeons and Dragons Plague of Ancients adventure, meant for players level 1-4.

This is the first version. With further testing / community advice, the PDF will be updated to Revision 2 on 5/7/2021.

Seed: Snipe Hunt

Warning: These adventures use the seeds as a base and then wildly diverge.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Way You Make Me Feel
boardgame.description:
You’re at a club on a Friday night, eager to have fun and lose yourself in the music. You see two people in the line for entry and have instant reactions to each of them. You want to connect in some way but don’t want to just outright ask or tell them everything. This isn’t the place for that. Try to let them know how they make you feel in other, more subtle ways.


The Way You Make Me Feel is inspired by Janelle Monae's "Make Me Feel" and is about exploring a single night at a club and finding out where it all leads in the end. Will you all leave together? Apart? Just two of you? Are you friends? Enemies? Lover? Something else? None of the above?

To play this game, you will need a Rider-Waite or similar Tarot deck, either as a physical deck or via an app. You may also want writing utensils, paper, and note cards.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.rpg: The Way You Make Me Feel

boardgame.name: The Watching Book
boardgame.description:
The Watching Book is an artifact left behind by the oracles of The Singing Plain. It is a testament to their culture, homeland, and history as written by generations of their beloved spiritualists. It is a gateway into a place that is long gone, accessible to us now only through games.

This Zine is set in the world of the Soothsayer board game. Much like its predecessor, the contents of this campaign are penned to be diegetic (in-universe) artifacts of a world long gone. This means the Zine is written from the first-person perspective of a variety of characters rather than presented as a module or dissertation. Through this Zine, presented as a “restored” and “translated” version of the original tablets, readers will discover a more in-depth and personal look at a society that worships the Wind.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Truth-Tellers
boardgame.description:
From PDF Introduction

This is a game played commonly by the children who lived in The Singing Plain. If you are a child, congratulations! You’re already ready to play. If you are an adult, fear not. Close your eyes, and imagine being a child again.
Keep imagining that as we play.

In this game, you are children pretending to be wise oracles. You will be discovering a mystery, solving it, and competing to seem the most wise among your peers.


Here’s some advice for play: be sure to say “hmmmmm” and “I see…” often. This will make you seem very wise. Try nodding and looking into the distance. Anything you imagine a wise old adult would do.

boardgame.name: Map of the Singing Plain
boardgame.description: The full illustration by Ezra Rose, unbroken by page breaks from within the pages of "The Watching Book'

boardgame.name: Hockey zu Hause
boardgame.description:
A tabletop hockey game from the 30s for 2 players and 1 Judge/Umpire. Players compete to score the highest number of goals based on dice roles.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Salvo! Denmark Strait, 1941
boardgame.description:
Salvo! Denmark Strait is a solitaire WW2 naval war game containing rules, game tables and war ships simulating The Battle of Denmark Strait in May, 1941. You'll need three dice (d6), paper and a pencil to play. Ship counters are included.

Extra warships allow for various "what if?" situations to be explored.

This game is part of Minden Games' 4 Naval WW2 Solitaire Games Bundle and is a companion game to Minden's Salvo! River Plate.

boardgame.name: Le Tour de France
boardgame.description:
Considered the classic version. This game has had multiple editions but no known edition has any credits on it. The board features the stages of the 1933 tour.

It is a game of goose. If you land on a field occupied by another player, you throw your dice again, and if you throw less (than the number you have thrown to land on that field), you go back to where you came from. On the other hand, if your throw is equal or higher, it is the other player who goes back to the field where you came from.

The first player to reach Paris wins.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Halls of Hegra
boardgame.description:
From an abandoned mountain fortress you command a group of Norwegian volunteers fighting numerically superior German forces in the early days of WW2.

Halls of Hegra is a solo only game in the same vein as Robinson Crusoe, This war of mine and Dead of winter. The mechanics are worker placement, bag building, and area control/ tower defense.

You play as the commander of the Norwegian forces during the three stages of the game.

1. Mobilization.
Explore the fortress while you dig your way through mountains of snow and broken equipment. New recruits are joining your growing force while you plan supply routes for the coming siege.

2. 1st. attack
The village below the fortress is attacked. You try to defend it while you do the final preparations before the Siege. Send out patrols behind enemy lines to secure enough supplies.

3. Siege
The Siege of fortress Hegra begins. You have to endure constant bombing and infantry attack while keeping the morale up amongst your men. Will you survive?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Toy Store Game
boardgame.description:
For 2-4 players. Game set up: Toy tokens are placed face down in one pile. Saleslady and rent tiles are placed face up in a second pile. Each player starts with a blank divided into 20 spaces.

Each player spins the spinner and picks up 1 or more of the appropriate tiles as indicated. When a player has filled his card, play stops and points are determined for each type of toy, again based on the results of the spinner. The player with the filled card received 5 bonus points.

The player with the most points wins.

Components:
1 double track spinner
4 blank card sheets

boardgame.name: The Mother Goose Game
boardgame.description:
Players must be the first to spin their way to Mother Goose by matching the color on the spinner to the color of the track.

Board and rules are printed in box

boardgame.name: Traffic: auf der Drehscheibe des Verkehrs
boardgame.description:
Each player gets 2 delivery trucks and starts from the central parking lot. The players have to pick up goods at the two factories and deliver them to several shops to collect game tokens while minding the traffic rules. Movement is determined by a die. At the roll of a 6 the turntable is rotated one step to change the traffic lights and various traffic signs.

When all goods are delivered and all trucks are returned to the parking lot, the player with the most tokens wins the game.

The traffic signs show that the game was published between 1971 and 1980.

boardgame.name: Μακριά γαιδούρα
boardgame.description:
Based on a traditional outdoor game.

In Long donkey players are divided into two teams. Each team has 4 pawns and one donkey with 8 card slots. Each card slot on the donkeys is divided into two parts: The defense area and the attack area.

The pawns of each team are “climbing” on the attack area of the opposite’s team donkey based on their jump cards. The other team must put a defense card on their donkey’s defense area.

Every slot of a team’s donkey has 1 stamina value by default.
Every single pawn burdens a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 1 weight value. No defense card needed on that slot by the defending team.

Every 2 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 4 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +4 defense card on that slot.

Every 3 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 9 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +8 defense card on that slot.

Every 4 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 16 weight value. The defending team needs at least the +2 +6 +8 defense cards on that slot.

The end of the game:
When there is less stamina value than the opponent’s weight value on a single slot of a donkey at the end of the turn, the attacking team wins the game!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Doubt Comes In
boardgame.description:
Doubt Comes In is a two player game inspired by by Anaïs Mitchell's album Hadestown, made for the the Record Collection 2K19 game jam. It's a game of love, loss, and ultimately, whether or not you can live with uncertainty.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Goon Goon Extra-dimensional Friends
boardgame.description:
This is a game of Mecha, Music, Monsters, and there might be some Matrimony, inspired by the best meta-series with transforming mecha and pop idols saving the galaxy.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Gods of the North
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

From the vast steppes of Russia to the gloomy underworld of Tueonela and the Twilight of the Gods! Introducing Marvelous Myths and Monsters - Gods of the North! This volume of the “Marvelous Myths and Monsters” series introduces a plethora of pantheons, spells and challenges to liven up your Marvel Superheroes Roleplaying Game™, from the Marvel RPG Unofficial Canon Project. Includes complete profiles on the Dievas, the Jumala, Wagner’s Ring Cycle, and more!

Adventure awaits!

boardgame.name: Face Factory
boardgame.description:
Face Factory is a print-and-play collaborative game about drawing faces and making characters. It's simple enough to be played with children, fast enough to be played at a restaurant while waiting for food, and entertaining enough to be enjoyed by anyone.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fighting Monsters
boardgame.description:
Yes, we were monsters. We had our difficulties and problems, but we were a community, held up by mighty pillars; we did little harm and kept to ourselves, we even worked together to make things better.



'Then the Terrors came.


Fighting Monsters is a story-telling and drawing game.

Players work together to create a community of monsters and then each takes the role of a Pillar of the community: unique members of this monster society that help hold things together and guide the others.

Then something terrible will happen: Terrors, beings of great power and size, will come and snatch away one of the Pillars. The game then explores how the community handles this loss and what permanent affects it has on its members.

Supports 2-6 players and requires writing/drawing implements, paper, cue cards, and a deck of standard playing cards (Jokers removed.).

boardgame.name: Masters of the Night: The Dark City
Władcy Nocy: Mroczne Miasto
boardgame.description:
A limited edition, Kickstarter-exclusive expansion containing new content and premium components. The expansion contains:


An additional playable character, Count Dalv
5 new District tiles
18 new Event cards
5 new Relic cards
12 Agent miniatures
9 Minion miniatures
Deluxe red pearl dice
Red resin blood tokens
Premium vampire sheets and box
Metal sigil, veil marker, and kill count tokens


The Dark City also includes three art prints and a story anthology by Gareth Hanrahan.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Five Tribes: Moedas Coins
boardgame.description:
This kit contains the exact amount of coins for the base Five Tribes game and consists of:

48 gilded $1 coins
48 gilded $5 coins


Characteristics of the coins:

25mm diameter
5g unit weight
Manufactured in zamak alloy, resistant to folds, dents and corrosion.

boardgame.name: Starframe
boardgame.description:
Starframe is a tactical, action-focused deck-building game for 1-4 players.

Starframe Station has been caught in a black hole. All souls aboard are in peril. Luckily, a mysterious being referred to as Sekhem, has arrived aboard the Station and is offering salvation. In Sekhem’s possession is a prototype engine capable of bending space-time which allows any ship that uses it to escape the black hole.
But there’s a catch…
The engine isn’t powerful enough to transport the Station… only a single Starframe Ship. Sekhem will sell the engine to the highest bidder, but only accepts payment in the form of Hyper-Matter, which must be earned before the Station reaches the Event Horizon.
As Starframe Station hurdles close to its doom Heroes will compete to:

Build their own Starframe Ships
Defend the Station against foes trying to steal the engine
Scavenge Hyper-Matter from nearby planets
Traverse the Abyss for larger caches of Hyper-Matter


It’s a race against the clock to win the auction and escape the Black Hole.
For everyone else…
the depths of the Black Hole await.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Figment
boardgame.description:
Figment is a simple story-game mainly intended for play with or by children. As an “ultra-lite” game it relies only upon rock-paper-scissors to settle matters of fate and requires almost nothing in the way of preparation. The story can be your own or drawn from your favorite fairy tales, myths, bed-time stories, movies, animation, etc. You only need a Storyteller, some Players, and boundless imagination!

This book includes all you need to play; how to make characters, how to resolve the results of actions, and guidance for running this game with children.

Formats include Digital Book & Phone PDF, below.

CC by 4.0 to encourage other creators to publish their own Figment content!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 545 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 545
April 2021
Ignorable Theme: What's a demon? Can an Evil mortal become a demon? Can a demon repent and become an angel? How does the GM roleplay an NPC demon? Have you ever roleplayed or seen a PC demon?

boardgame.name: Flintlock
boardgame.description:
Guildhall is an archipelago nation, far from the war and politics of the continent, but deeply embroiled in its own struggles... ages ago it was run by the Council of Archmages, but they all died when the world's magic started to slip away, and the islands are trying to hold onto civilization with dying spells and failing artifacts.

Worse, the great Sea Walls have finally fallen, leaving Guildhall open to the beasts from the ocean, where monsters beyond imagination dwell.

You are a member of the Flintlock Society: your soul has been bound to a ship, giving you incredible resilience and magical skill, in exchange for battling the many, many sea monsters which threaten your nation.

Flintlock is a story game that's primarily about describing big, pirate-themed action set-pieces, in which you dramatically lash out at a watery monster which will, in turn, lash back at you. Think of it less as a game and more as a "cool scene engine."

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: FONT
boardgame.description:
You left a dying world for the perilous FISSURE, from which few
return. You seek the FONT, which will change everything.

A game for 3-5 people over 1-2 hours.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Oceania Expansion – Meeple Source Nectar tokens (69 pcs)
boardgame.description: This upgrade most typically includes 3-4 painted wooden pieces of the 22 real-life flower designs (69 total pieces). This list currently includes: Sturt's Desert Rose, Pink Anemone, Columbine, Hellebores, Lavender, Morning Glory, Red Anemone, Star Jasmine, Purple Pansy, Magnolia, Tiger Lily, Hibiscus, Cattleya Orchid, Rose, Chamomile, Poinsettia, Sunflower, Water Lily, Gaillardia, Purple Calla Lily, Cherry Blossom, and Star Gazer Lily. Please be aware that no specific flower is guaranteed to have any exact number of pieces though!

boardgame.name: Full of Memory & Anger
boardgame.description:
The forest stands old. When the fog rolls in at dusk, and the boots of mailed adventurers crush stems and ferns, these trees uproot. Not quenched by rain or river, the forest drinks the blood of its invaders. This forest is old, full of memory, and anger.

You stand, within the core of ancient aspen or old oak, feeling the flow of sap in spring and the frozen silence of icy winter. As the forest breathes, you burn the bones of those who sought to carve through. Cruel dryads, all, you and your fellow spirits spire upwards toward the light of stars, and score the stone beneath your roots with deep cracking force.

And one day hatred walks in your domain. Fire and steel assails wood and stone as armored knights, gnarled wizards, and shrike sharp rogues bring death with them. Passing through wood like doors you emerge, recondite and wielding blades of razor thin fern. You defend the woods. And for now the intruders melt into the dirt and you sleep once again. If a hate-filled heart screams in the forest and no one is around to hear it, does it still make a sound?

Full of Memory And Anger is a meditation game of time and stillness, interrupted by brief scenes of ecological retribution. You play fae creatures living in the heartwood of old growth trees, dispensing asymmetrical retaliation to intruders in your realm. These intruders may bring with them evil and hate. They may be powerful fantasy adventurers, formidable masters of industry, or indiscriminate agents of chaos and pollution. You will always crush them in terrifying ways.

This game is inspired by The Skeletons by Bully Pulpit Games. It is a game of answering questions, but more importantly it is a game of silence and of waiting.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Garrote Couture
boardgame.description:
Based off of Graham Walmsley's innovative game Cthulhu Dark, Garrote Couture brings us fabulous models in gorgeous clothing, all trying to get to fashion week events without ruining their ensembles. Every cabby, every bike messenger, even every other model is a potential threat. But you can get there with grace and style, n'est ce pas?

Uses 3d6 per player, plus notecards and pencils.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Geese At The Beach: Creatures Tasked With Collecting Things For The Feathery Overlord
boardgame.description:
THE GOOSE KING HAS AWOKEN. The annual event has arrived, in which the Goose King rises and sends his most powerful Geese soldiers to the dangerous lands of The Beach to gather Shiny things for his most powerful Horde. Perhaps he simply wants as much treasure as possible, or perhaps he yearns for the greatest treasure of all.

Regardless of his wants, it is on you and your squad of geese to brave the horrors of The Beach and battle the Goose King's enemies to bring the king what he desires most: Shinies. If the Goose King's wants are not met, the risk of all out war between The Goose King and the Seagull Armada could threaten to drown the world.

PLAY AS ALL YOUR FAVORITE GOOSE BREEDS:

The Buff Goose
The Duck
The Pelican
The Cat
The Fish
WITH MORE GEESE OPTIONS COMING SOON.


Needed For This Game:
-2d8
-Many, Many Tokens

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire – Denial Alternate Art Promo Card
boardgame.description: Promo alternative art card for Warhammer Underworlds Shadespire

boardgame.name: Out of the Park Baseball 22
boardgame.description:
PLAY WHAT THE PROS PLAY
THE WORLD’S BEST BASEBALL STRATEGY GAME

Manage your favorite baseball team from the front office and in the dugout. Unprecedented depth, beautiful 3D views of the action, and total control of your franchise!

2021 MLB Opening Day rosters including all the real minor leagues – fully licensed by MLB, the MLBPA and Minor League Baseball. Many international and independent leagues are featured with accurate rosters, too!

Sign free agents, draft the next superstar, negotiate trades, discover and develop top prospects. Guide your franchise into the infinite future!

Manage your teams in beautiful new 3D stadiums, including brand new stadiums for all the MLB and KBO clubs!
Play solo, participate in exciting online leagues, or compete against the world in Perfect Team mode for the ultimate challenge!

Build and customize your own fictional baseball world and choose from over 800 custom team logos.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Gentleman Bandit
boardgame.description:
A solo roleplaying game exploring violence, woe, and dissociation.



They call you the Gentleman Bandit, because no one knows your name. They call you a monster, a villain, a dealer of death.



But they don’t know you.



Not your Heart, your Poet’s Heart filled with rage or filth or the expansiveness of True Love; not your Grieving Heart loosed over a chasm, making a sound like the sorrow of wolves as it plummets toward wet river stones, cracked bones left to bleach.


In this writing-focused RPG, you personify the eponymous Gentleman Bandit to write a 13-line poem you'll leave for the dead — and the ones who discover them. Card draws guide the content of each line; optional dice rolls add poetic devices to further shape the experience and ratchet the difficulty.

Rules for multiplayer versions — inspired by the Exquisite Corpse style of group poetry writing — are included for both in-room and online settings.

A Poker Play ruleset supports replayability with recommended fictional positions for your Bandit, each corresponding to the poker hand(s) you hold at the end of a round.

Your Tools

Writing implements of your choice
A well-shuffled deck of 54 playing cards, Jokers intact
One six-sided die (optional)

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Gondola
boardgame.description:
Gondola is a cooperative card game using a subset of a standard deck of playing cards using only the ace, 2-7, Jack, King, and Queen.

It is played in rounds, each of which have two phases (Loading and Delivery). A standard game of Gondola ends after three rounds, while a long game (called a double-shift) ends after six rounds.

The Loading Phase is similar to a game of Blackjack or Pontoon in which the players are trying to get a total value of 13 without going over. The Delivery Phase involves a cooperative scoring of points.

Gondolieri and the Wakemaker
The players of Gondola are the Gondolieri, taking the place of the legendary canal-traversing figures of Pentola, singers of abjuring ballads and destroyers of the demons who lurk in the city’s waters. Those demons are represented by the Wakemaker, who is the dealer.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Das doppelt-Sechs Spiel
boardgame.description:
Game of double Six. After having staked for the pool, the players throw two dice and he who has the most points, begins. The dice under the figures show the number of points, whereas the numbers at the top indicate how much a player shall receive from or pay to the pool. The white stars win, the black stars lose. If a player throws 2 points, he gets half the pool but loses a turn. On the throw of 12 points, the player wins the game and the pool and is the starting player for the next game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Necromancer
boardgame.description:
The Necromancer is a one player The Wretched hack that uses birthday candles, a tarot deck, a 6 sided dice, and a journal to tell the queer story of a necromancer desperate to return their dead love back to life. I made heavy use of The Wretched & Alone SRD in writing this, but it is a stand alone game!



The Story

Necromancy is a curse and a disease, and it inevitably kills the practitioner. You’re not entirely sure what you did to become a necromancer, but you know that the forces of life and death themselves now bend to your will. Upon the discovery of your necromancy, the town you live in pushed you to the very outskirts. They now treat you with scorn and derision, as if the whims of fate had been yours to command, and you chose this death sentence for yourself.

You are hideously powerful, you could snap a mortal in twain with but a thought if you wished to. You can make legions of corpses rise from the dead and dance for days without exerting yourself at all. As far as you are aware, the one thing you can’t do seems to be true resurrection. Animating a body and reattaching a soul are two entirely different things, and what good is one without the other?

Your partner has recently died. As you aren’t blessed with foresight, you didn’t see it coming, but you are possibly the only person who can fix this. You can bring them back. You found a book which contains a ritual to revive them for real, but it’s dangerous, and you know that using your powers will hasten your own death if you aren’t careful. The ritual is incomplete, and your earnest belief is that the person who wrote it probably died trying to complete it.

You have to give it a try, though. Your death, your failure, is almost inevitable… but you know they would have done it for you, and there is a chance it will work out. There is a chance you can see them again.

You’d do anything for that chance.



Content Warnings

Some specific content to be aware of includes: physical injury, abandonment, death & sickness (as well as descriptions of both, in both people and animals), and general misery.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Pax Renaissance: 2nd Edition – Metal Coins
boardgame.description: This set contains 34 metal coins (Florentine florins replies) and 4 plastic red gems to replace the plastic coins for the game Pax Renaissance 2nd edition.

boardgame.name: Tokyo Sidekick
boardgame.description:
Publishers description:

In a special partnership with Japanime Games, we have statted out 20 larger-than-life personalities (and their items) for BESM Fourth Edition that are featured in the upcoming Tokyo Sidekick anime superhero board game. Combining anime and superheroes together in a full-colour, 24-page NPC expansion? Yes, please!

boardgame.name: Pax Viking: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: 80 metal coins to replace the cardboard coins of the game Pax Viking. The set contains 20 "Gold" coins and 60 "Silver" coins.
